1119186632660410368.text: Next up on NASA TV: Live coverage of the @NorthropGrumman #Cygnus  arrival at @Space_Station  returns at 7am ET. Ground controllers will remotely install the spacecraft to the station's Unity module, where it will stay until the end of July. Watch: https://go.nasa.gov/2GoHc8Y pic.twitter.com/Nc6hvwTlL6

1120369384269152256.text: The Exp 59 crew has been unpacking the #Cygnus cargo craft over the weekend and began science operations on the newly delivered space research. https://go.nasa.gov/2VgOuFi pic.twitter.com/pT10nwyQic

1112828460131667968.text: This month we are featuring our #OmegArocket on our Twitter banner! We are proud to provide the @usairforce with a smart approach to space launch with a vehicle that features a reliable design, flight-proven avionics and an experienced team. Learn more: http://northropgrumman.com/omega pic.twitter.com/UH6ysDa0Ay

1122914743646412801.text: The @NASAWebb Telescope is changing this world before it even leaves the ground. Several advancements developed for #JWST have already become valuable spin-off technologies in their own right. Learn more about #NorthropGrumman's contributions: http://ms.spr.ly/6016THr3K pic.twitter.com/NsK7sVOYEa

1123240598721396739.text: Firebird is a medium-altitude system designed to meet a wide range of customer missions, from military ISR to humanitarian assistance, and available in manned, autonomous, or optionally piloted models. Learn more: http://northropgrumman.com/firebird  #NorthropGrumman #AUVSI #Xponentialpic.twitter.com/Puq4gZcHy2

1121808846954082305.text: Mitch is a contracts manager at #NorthropGrumman. In this video, he shares his thoughts and emotions as he prepares to deploy to the Middle East for nine months as with the @AirForceReserve. 1121825029854060545.text: Making moves! Following the second qualification test for our #GEM63 motor on April 4, an inert motor is prepared for transportation to @NASAKennedy. Next stop: supporting @ulalaunch’s #AltasV rocket  #NorthropGrummanpic.twitter.com/yBy2MvuKtN

1123326833716531200.text: Science fiction recently became a reality of sorts when two professors of engineering used sound wave technology to levitate objects. 1120805048085356546.text:
Bioacoustics date as far back as the early 20th century, when scientists started studying insect sounds. Now we apply those ideas to rain forests, marine life, and even space. #NorthropGrumman

1120405670543679489.text: #ICYMI last week #NorthropGrumman launched our #Cygnus spacecraft to the @Space_Station! #Antares launched from @NASA_Wallops on April 17 and Cygnus docked with the orbiting laboratory early on April 19.
